intro: Oenothera cambrica, commonly known as the British evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, hence its common name. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Oenothera cambrica typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is often found in temperate climates. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators like moths and beetles.
